newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian bonds await exchange auction.
newsitem.headline: Belgian bonds await exchange auction.

text.p: The looming, and possibly large, linear bond exchange auction on Tuesday proved the main focus of attention for the Belgian market on Monday and will dominate tomorrow's session, traders said.
"A lot of supply is expected at Tuesday's auction. It will be the last opportunity for people to either swap out of OLO 15 or hold it until maturity," one trader said.
OLO 15, which has 98 billion Belgian francs outstanding, matures this month.
"People are watching to see if there are interesting terms on offer for investors," the trader added.
The Belgian Treasury is offering OLOs 27 (4.00 pct, Jan 2000), 6 (9.00 pct, March 2003), 19 (6.50 pct, March 2005) and 26 (6.25 pct, March 2007) in exchange for OLO 15 and OLO 8.
Traders said the prospect of the auction capped price rises elsewhere in the market on a fairly quiet Monday, with some end investors seen but activity mainly confined to professionals.
"There was good interest in OLO 15 today as well as in OLO 26 and, to a lesser extent, OLOs 19 and 24," one trader said.
Traders said the market strength during the day -- after a four-day break -- was largely attributable to stronger Bunds and rising U.S. Treasuries.
The yield of the benchmark March 2007 OLO ended at 5.81 percent against Wednesday's closing 5.87, with the spread over Bunds 11 basis points against 10.
The June futures contract was 37 basis points up at 121.64 having spent the morning with gains hovering around 17 basis points.
